description: From Ancient Greek λειπογγράμμα (leipongrámma), from λείπω (leípō, “leaving out”) +‎ γράμμα (grámma, “letter”), 18th c.

entries.meaning: (literature) A word or writing that does not use a particular symbol or symbols.
examples: "Transubstantiationalists" is a particularly long single-word lipogram, not using the letter "e".
